speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: SCENE I. Before OLIVIA's house.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter SEBASTIAN and Clown

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Will you make me believe that I am not sent for you?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Go to, go to, thou art a foolish fellow:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Let me be clear of thee.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well held out, i' faith! No, I do not know you; nor

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am not sent to you by my lady, to bid you come

speaker: Clown
text_entry: speak with her; nor your name is not Master Cesario;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: nor this is not my nose neither. Nothing that is so is so.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I prithee, vent thy folly somewhere else: Thou

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: know'st not me.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Vent my folly! he has heard that word of some

speaker: Clown
text_entry: great man and now applies it to a fool. Vent my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: folly! I am afraid this great lubber, the world,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will prove a cockney. I prithee now, ungird thy

speaker: Clown
text_entry: strangeness and tell me what I shall vent to my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: lady: shall I vent to her that thou art coming?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I prithee, foolish Greek, depart from me: There's

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: money for thee: if you tarry longer, I shall give

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: worse payment.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: By my troth, thou hast an open hand. These wise men

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that give fools money get themselves a good

speaker: Clown
text_entry: report--after fourteen years' purchase.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter SIR ANDREW, SIR TOBY BELCH, and FABIAN

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Now, sir, have I met you again? there's for you.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Why, there's for thee, and there, and there. Are all

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: the people mad?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Hold, sir, or I'll throw your dagger o'er the house.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: This will I tell my lady straight: I would not be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: in some of your coats for two pence.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come on, sir; hold.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Nay, let him alone: I'll go another way to work

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: with him; I'll have an action of battery against

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: him, if there be any law in Illyria: though I

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: struck him first, yet it's no matter for that.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Let go thy hand.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come, sir, I will not let you go. Come, my young

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: soldier, put up your iron: you are well fleshed; come on.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I will be free from thee. What wouldst thou now? If

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: thou darest tempt me further, draw thy sword.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: What, what? Nay, then I must have an ounce or two

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: of this malapert blood from you.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hold, Toby; on thy life I charge thee, hold!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Madam!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Will it be ever thus? Ungracious wretch,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Fit for the mountains and the barbarous caves,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Where manners ne'er were preach'd! out of my sight!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Be not offended, dear Cesario.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Rudesby, be gone!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I prithee, gentle friend,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Let thy fair wisdom, not thy passion, sway

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: In this uncivil and thou unjust extent

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Against thy peace. Go with me to my house,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And hear thou there how many fruitless pranks

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: This ruffian hath botch'd up, that thou thereby

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Mayst smile at this: thou shalt not choose but go:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Do not deny. Beshrew his soul for me,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: He started one poor heart of mine in thee.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: What relish is in this? how runs the stream?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Or I am mad, or else this is a dream:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Let fancy still my sense in Lethe steep;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: If it be thus to dream, still let me sleep!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Nay, come, I prithee; would thou'ldst be ruled by me!

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Madam, I will.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, say so, and so be!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt
